description: Rear roof extension incorporating window and installation of two roof lights to front roof slope (replacing existing roof light to the front and rear roof slopes)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings titled: 	Proposed Amended Plans PL300 RevB - A1 Proposed Floor Plans and drawing no.PL400 RevB - A1 Proposed Amended Elevation and Section.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The materials to be used for the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing, unless where stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D1 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) - section 12

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment, revision or new Order) no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason:  To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D3 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) - section 12.	 | The hereby approved rooflights to the front roof slope shall be conservation style and lie flush with the roof and retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To ensure that the proposed development does not detract from the character and appearance of the wider conservation area, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), policy D3 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and National Planning Policy Framework 2021 sections 12 and 16.
